DOC.brief_title: Noninvasive Monitoring Uterine Electrical Activity Fetal Heart Rate : A New External Monitoring Device
DOC.detailed_description: Purpose : The investigator propose perform study validate accuracy clinical usefulness EUM device compare simultaneous use current method ( external internal device ) among obese patient patient normal body mass index ( BMI ) . Objectives : 1 . Compare contraction obtain use EUM device vs. obtain use intrauterine pressure catheter vs. obtain external tocodynamometer among current obese patient ( BMI great 30 kg/m2 ) nonobese patient use simultaneously obtain , 30 minute tracing regard frequency contraction , duration contraction , maximum height contraction , total Montevideo unit record , time contraction , amount discontinuous tracing device . 2 . Compare fetal heart rate tracing obtain via EUM device vs. external fetal Doppler vs. fetal scalp electrode ( simultaneously obtain , 30 minute tracing compare ) among obese patient nonobese patient regard amount discontinuous/unterinterpetable tracing , average fetal heart rate , baseline heart rate , number acceleration , number deceleration , time acceleration , time deceleration , maximum fetal heart rate achieve acceleration , low fetal heart rate achieve deceleration , compare degree variability tracing . 3 . Compare tracing productive vs. non-productive contraction patient present triage rule labor ( 30 minute simultaneously obtain tracing external tocodynamometer EUM device compare ) regard frequency contraction , duration contraction , maximum height contraction , time contraction amount discontinuous tracing device , well change cervical exam basis body mass index .
